summary: Contributor-facing roadmap grounded in repository TODOs and existing modules

milestones.title: Coordinate CLI improvements & UX
milestones.problem: No clear CLI contract or tests; contributors need a coordinated set of small, testable tasks and acceptance criteria for CLI behavior.
parallelizable_tasks: Add basic tests for CLI behavior (e.g., tests/test_cli.py)
Improve README docs describing CLI usage
Add small, well-scoped CLI subcommands (e.g., `list`, `run`) with tests

milestones.title: Coordinate storage refactor and persistence strategy
milestones.problem: Current storage is a single in-memory list; unfolding persistence/backends and thread-safety requires coordinated API and migration plan.
parallelizable_tasks: Add tests that assert store semantics (e.g., isolation, clear/reset)
Introduce an interface or abstraction layer for storage
Add simple implementations (in-memory, file-based) behind the abstraction

milestones.title: Coordinate error handling semantics & test coverage
milestones.problem: No defined behavior when tasks fail (stop vs collect errors); contributors need agreed error model and tests to avoid incompatible implementations.
parallelizable_tasks: Add tests for common error semantics (task raises exception -> runner behavior)
Implement simple error-handling modes (fail-fast vs collect-and-report)

milestones.title: Coordinate parallel execution model and API
milestones.problem: Parallel execution is on the TODO list but requires coordinated decisions about concurrency model, API surface, and thread-safety across core and storage.
parallelizable_tasks: Prototype concurrency using experimental scheduler module
Add tests validating concurrency behavior (race conditions, ordering guarantees)
Benchmark small task sets to validate approach

milestones.title: Document experimental modules and stabilization plan
milestones.problem: Experimental modules lack usage docs and clear stabilization criteria; contributors need guidance on what is experimental and how to help stabilize (or archive) APIs.
parallelizable_tasks: Add documentation and examples for DAG and scheduler in README or docs/
Add simple usage examples as tests or examples folder
Create issues that call out stabilization criteria (e.g., API contract, tests, performance goals)

parallelizable_across_milestones: Documentation and README updates (m1, m3, m5)
Adding tests and coverage for current behavior (m1, m2, m3)
Small, non-breaking refactors (splitting files, adding interfaces)

usage_notes: This report is a coordination tool: create issues/labels per milestone (e.g., 'milestone: m2-storage-refactor'), split work into first-timer-friendly tasks where possible, and list maintainer-decisions explicitly (API, semantics, compatibility).
